00020 /*
00021 *********************************************************************************************************
00022 *                                        CHANGE PRIORITY OF A TASK
00023 *
00024 * Description: This function allows you to change the priority of a task dynamically.  Note that the new
00025 *              priority MUST be available.
00026 *
00027 * Arguments  : oldp     is the old priority
00028 *
00029 *              newp     is the new priority
00030 *
00031 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR          is the call was successful
00032 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID    if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00033 *                                 (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO)
00034 *              OS_PRIO_EXIST      if the new priority already exist.
00035 *              OS_PRIO_ERR        there is no task with the specified OLD priority (i.e. the OLD task does
00036 *                                 not exist.
00037 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST  if the task is assigned to a Mutex PIP.
00038 *********************************************************************************************************
00039 */
00040 
00041 #if OS_TASK_CHANGE_PRIO_EN > 0
00042 INT8U  OSTaskChangePrio (INT8U oldprio, INT8U newprio)
00043 {
00044 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00045     OS_EVENT    *pevent;
00046 #endif
00047     OS_TCB      *ptcb;
00048     INT8U        x;
00049     INT8U        y;
00050     INT8U        bitx;
00051     INT8U        bity;
00052     INT8U        y_old;
00053 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                     
00054     OS_CPU_SR    cpu_sr = 0;                                    /* Storage for CPU status register     */
00055 #endif    
00056 
00057 
00058 
00059 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00060     if (oldprio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {
00061             if (oldprio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {
00062             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00063                 }
00064         }
00065     if (newprio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {
00066         return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00067     }
00068 #endif
00069     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00070     if (OSTCBPrioTbl[newprio] != (OS_TCB *)0) {                 /* New priority must not already exist */
00071         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00072         return (OS_PRIO_EXIST);
00073     } 
00074     if (oldprio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                              /* See if changing self                */
00075         oldprio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;                          /* Yes, get priority                   */
00076     }
00077     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[oldprio];
00078     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                                  /* Does task to change exist?          */
00079         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                                     /* No, can't change its priority!      */
00080         return (OS_PRIO_ERR);
00081     }                                       
00082     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                                  /* Is task assigned to Mutex           */
00083         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                                     /* No, can't change its priority!      */
00084         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00085     }                                       
00086     y                     = newprio >> 3;                       /* Yes, compute new TCB fields         */
00087     bity                  = OSMapTbl[y];
00088     x                     = newprio & 0x07;
00089     bitx                  = OSMapTbl[x];
00090     OSTCBPrioTbl[oldprio] = (OS_TCB *)0;                        /* Remove TCB from old priority        */
00091     OSTCBPrioTbl[newprio] = ptcb;                               /* Place pointer to TCB @ new priority */
00092     y_old                 = ptcb->OSTCBY;
00093     if ((OSRdyTbl[y_old] & ptcb->OSTCBBitX) != 0x00) {          /* If task is ready make it not        */
00094         OSRdyTbl[y_old] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00095         if (OSRdyTbl[y_old] == 0x00) {
00096             OSRdyGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00097         }
00098         OSRdyGrp    |= bity;                                    /* Make new priority ready to run      */
00099         OSRdyTbl[y] |= bitx;
00100 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00101     } else {                                                    /* Task was not ready ...              */
00102         pevent = ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr;
00103         if (pevent != (OS_EVENT *)0) {                          /* ... remove from event wait list     */
00104             pevent->OSEventTbl[y_old] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00105             if (pevent->OSEventTbl[y_old] == 0) {
00106                 pevent->OSEventGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00107             }
00108             pevent->OSEventGrp    |= bity;                      /* Add new priority to wait list       */
00109             pevent->OSEventTbl[y] |= bitx;
00110         }
00111 #endif
00112     }
00113     ptcb->OSTCBPrio = newprio;                                  /* Set new task priority               */
00114     ptcb->OSTCBY    = y;
00115     ptcb->OSTCBX    = x;
00116     ptcb->OSTCBBitY = bity;
00117     ptcb->OSTCBBitX = bitx;
00118     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00119     OS_Sched();                                                 /* Run highest priority task ready     */
00120     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00121 }
00122 #endif
00123 /*$PAGE*/
00124 /*
00125 *********************************************************************************************************
00126 *                                            CREATE A TASK
00127 *
00128 * Description: This function is used to have uC/OS-II manage the execution of a task.  Tasks can either
00129 *              be created prior to the start of multitasking or by a running task.  A task cannot be
00130 *              created by an ISR.
00131 *
00132 * Arguments  : task     is a pointer to the task's code
00133 *
00134 *              p_arg    is a pointer to an optional data area which can be used to pass parameters to
00135 *                       the task when the task first executes.  Where the task is concerned it thinks
00136 *                       it was invoked and passed the argument 'p_arg' as follows:
00137 *
00138 *                           void Task (void *p_arg)
00139 *                           {
00140 *                               for (;;) {
00141 *                                   Task code;
00142 *                               }
00143 *                           }
00144 *
00145 *              ptos     is a pointer to the task's top of stack.  If the configuration constant
00146 *                       OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1, the stack is assumed to grow downward (i.e. from high
00147 *                       memory to low memory).  'pstk' will thus point to the highest (valid) memory
00148 *                       location of the stack.  If OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0, 'pstk' will point to the
00149 *                       lowest memory location of the stack and the stack will grow with increasing
00150 *                       memory locations.
00151 *
00152 *              prio     is the task's priority.  A unique priority MUST be assigned to each task and the
00153 *                       lower the number, the higher the priority.
00154 *
00155 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR               if the function was successful.
00156 *              OS_PRIO_EXIT            if the task priority already exist
00157 *                                      (each task MUST have a unique priority).
00158 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID         if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00159 *                                      (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO)
00160 *              OS_ERR_TASK_CREATE_ISR  if you tried to create a task from an ISR.
00161 *********************************************************************************************************
00162 */
00163 
00164 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EN > 0
00165 INT8U  OSTaskCreate (void (*task)(void *pd), void *p_arg, OS_STK *ptos, INT8U prio)
00166 {
00167     OS_STK    *psp;
00168     INT8U      err;
00169 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                  /* Allocate storage for CPU status register               */
00170     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00171 #endif    
00172 
00173 
00174 
00175 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00176     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {             /* Make sure priority is within allowable range           */
00177         return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00178     }
00179 #endif
00180     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00181     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                  /* Make sure we don't create the task from within an ISR  */
00182         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00183         return (OS_ERR_TASK_CREATE_ISR);
00184     }
00185     if (OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] == (OS_TCB *)0) { /* Make sure task doesn't already exist at this priority  */
00186         OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)1;    /* Reserve the priority to prevent others from doing ...  */
00187                                              /* ... the same thing until task is created.              */
00188         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00189         psp = (OS_STK *)OSTaskStkInit(task, p_arg, ptos, 0);    /* Initialize the task's stack         */
00190         err = OS_TCBInit(prio, psp, (OS_STK *)0, 0, 0, (void *)0, 0);
00191         if (err == OS_NO_ERR) {
00192             if (OSRunning == TRUE) {         /* Find highest priority task if multitasking has started */
00193                 OS_Sched();
00194             }
00195         } else {
00196             OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00197             OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)0;/* Make this priority available to others                 */
00198             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00199         }
00200         return (err);
00201     }
00202     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00203     return (OS_PRIO_EXIST);
00204 }
00205 #endif
00206 /*$PAGE*/
00207 /*
00208 *********************************************************************************************************
00209 *                                     CREATE A TASK (Extended Version)
00210 *
00211 * Description: This function is used to have uC/OS-II manage the execution of a task.  Tasks can either
00212 *              be created prior to the start of multitasking or by a running task.  A task cannot be
00213 *              created by an ISR.  This function is similar to OSTaskCreate() except that it allows
00214 *              additional information about a task to be specified.
00215 *
00216 * Arguments  : task      is a pointer to the task's code
00217 *
00218 *              p_arg     is a pointer to an optional data area which can be used to pass parameters to
00219 *                        the task when the task first executes.  Where the task is concerned it thinks
00220 *                        it was invoked and passed the argument 'p_arg' as follows:
00221 *
00222 *                            void Task (void *p_arg)
00223 *                            {
00224 *                                for (;;) {
00225 *                                    Task code;
00226 *                                }
00227 *                            }
00228 *
00229 *              ptos      is a pointer to the task's top of stack.  If the configuration constant
00230 *                        OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1, the stack is assumed to grow downward (i.e. from high
00231 *                        memory to low memory).  'ptos' will thus point to the highest (valid) memory
00232 *                        location of the stack.  If OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0, 'ptos' will point to the
00233 *                        lowest memory location of the stack and the stack will grow with increasing
00234 *                        memory locations.  'ptos' MUST point to a valid 'free' data item.
00235 *
00236 *              prio      is the task's priority.  A unique priority MUST be assigned to each task and the
00237 *                        lower the number, the higher the priority.
00238 *
00239 *              id        is the task's ID (0..65535)
00240 *
00241 *              pbos      is a pointer to the task's bottom of stack.  If the configuration constant
00242 *                        OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1, the stack is assumed to grow downward (i.e. from high
00243 *                        memory to low memory).  'pbos' will thus point to the LOWEST (valid) memory
00244 *                        location of the stack.  If OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0, 'pbos' will point to the
00245 *                        HIGHEST memory location of the stack and the stack will grow with increasing
00246 *                        memory locations.  'pbos' MUST point to a valid 'free' data item.
00247 *
00248 *              stk_size  is the size of the stack in number of elements.  If OS_STK is set to INT8U,
00249 *                        'stk_size' corresponds to the number of bytes available.  If OS_STK is set to
00250 *                        INT16U, 'stk_size' contains the number of 16-bit entries available.  Finally, if
00251 *                        OS_STK is set to INT32U, 'stk_size' contains the number of 32-bit entries
00252 *                        available on the stack.
00253 *
00254 *              pext      is a pointer to a user supplied memory location which is used as a TCB extension.
00255 *                        For example, this user memory can hold the contents of floating-point registers
00256 *                        during a context switch, the time each task takes to execute, the number of times
00257 *                        the task has been switched-in, etc.
00258 *
00259 *              opt       contains additional information (or options) about the behavior of the task.  The
00260 *                        LOWER 8-bits are reserved by uC/OS-II while the upper 8 bits can be application
00261 *                        specific.  See OS_TASK_OPT_??? in uCOS-II.H.  Current choices are:
00262 *
00263 *                        OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK      Stack checking to be allowed for the task
00264 *                        OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR      Clear the stack when the task is created
00265 *                        OS_TASK_OPT_SAVE_FP      If the CPU has floating-point registers, save them
00266 *                                                 during a context switch.
00267 *
00268 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR               if the function was successful.
00269 *              OS_PRIO_EXIT            if the task priority already exist
00270 *                                      (each task MUST have a unique priority).
00271 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID         if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00272 *                                      (i.e. > OS_LOWEST_PRIO)
00273 *              OS_ERR_TASK_CREATE_ISR  if you tried to create a task from an ISR.
00274 *********************************************************************************************************
00275 */
00276 /*$PAGE*/
00277 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
00278 INT8U  OSTaskCreateExt (void   (*task)(void *pd),
00279                         void    *p_arg,
00280                         OS_STK  *ptos,
00281                         INT8U    prio,
00282                         INT16U   id,
00283                         OS_STK  *pbos,
00284                         INT32U   stk_size,
00285                         void    *pext,
00286                         INT16U   opt)
00287 {
00288     OS_STK    *psp;
00289     INT8U      err;
00290 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                  /* Allocate storage for CPU status register               */
00291     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00292 #endif    
00293 
00294 
00295 
00296 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00297     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {             /* Make sure priority is within allowable range           */
00298         return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00299     }
00300 #endif
00301     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00302     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                  /* Make sure we don't create the task from within an ISR  */
00303         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00304         return (OS_ERR_TASK_CREATE_ISR);
00305     }
00306     if (OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] == (OS_TCB *)0) { /* Make sure task doesn't already exist at this priority  */
00307         OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)1;    /* Reserve the priority to prevent others from doing ...  */
00308                                              /* ... the same thing until task is created.              */
00309         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00310 
00311         OS_TaskStkClr(pbos, stk_size, opt);                    /* Clear the task stack (if needed)     */
00312 
00313         psp = (OS_STK *)OSTaskStkInit(task, p_arg, ptos, opt); /* Initialize the task's stack          */
00314         err = OS_TCBInit(prio, psp, pbos, id, stk_size, pext, opt);
00315         if (err == OS_NO_ERR) {
00316             if (OSRunning == TRUE) {                           /* Find HPT if multitasking has started */
00317                 OS_Sched();
00318             }
00319         } else {
00320             OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00321             OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)0;                  /* Make this priority avail. to others  */
00322             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00323         }
00324         return (err);
00325     }
00326     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00327     return (OS_PRIO_EXIST);
00328 }
00329 #endif
00330 /*$PAGE*/
00331 /*
00332 *********************************************************************************************************
00333 *                                            DELETE A TASK
00334 *
00335 * Description: This function allows you to delete a task.  The calling task can delete itself by
00336 *              its own priority number.  The deleted task is returned to the dormant state and can be
00337 *              re-activated by creating the deleted task again.
00338 *
00339 * Arguments  : prio    is the priority of the task to delete.  Note that you can explicitely delete
00340 *                      the current task without knowing its priority level by setting 'prio' to
00341 *                      OS_PRIO_SELF.
00342 *
00343 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR           if the call is successful
00344 *              OS_TASK_DEL_IDLE    if you attempted to delete uC/OS-II's idle task
00345 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID     if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00346 *                                  (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) or, you have not specified OS_PRIO_SELF.
00347 *              OS_TASK_DEL_ERR     if the task you want to delete does not exist.
00348 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST   if the task is assigned to a Mutex PIP.
00349 *              OS_TASK_DEL_ISR     if you tried to delete a task from an ISR
00350 *
00351 * Notes      : 1) To reduce interrupt latency, OSTaskDel() 'disables' the task:
00352 *                    a) by making it not ready
00353 *                    b) by removing it from any wait lists
00354 *                    c) by preventing OSTimeTick() from making the task ready to run.
00355 *                 The task can then be 'unlinked' from the miscellaneous structures in uC/OS-II.
00356 *              2) The function OS_Dummy() is called after OS_EXIT_CRITICAL() because, on most processors,
00357 *                 the next instruction following the enable interrupt instruction is ignored.  
00358 *              3) An ISR cannot delete a task.
00359 *              4) The lock nesting counter is incremented because, for a brief instant, if the current
00360 *                 task is being deleted, the current task would not be able to be rescheduled because it
00361 *                 is removed from the ready list.  Incrementing the nesting counter prevents another task
00362 *                 from being schedule.  This means that an ISR would return to the current task which is
00363 *                 being deleted.  The rest of the deletion would thus be able to be completed.
00364 *********************************************************************************************************
00365 */
00366 /*$PAGE*/
00367 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
00368 INT8U  OSTaskDel (INT8U prio)
00369 {
00370 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00371     OS_EVENT     *pevent;
00372 #endif    
00373 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0)
00374     OS_FLAG_NODE *pnode;
00375 #endif
00376     OS_TCB       *ptcb;
00377         INT8U         y;
00378 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00379     OS_CPU_SR     cpu_sr = 0;
00380 #endif    
00381 
00382 
00383 
00384     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                     /* See if trying to delete from ISR    */
00385         return (OS_TASK_DEL_ISR);
00386     }
00387 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00388     if (prio == OS_IDLE_PRIO) {                                 /* Not allowed to delete idle task     */
00389         return (OS_TASK_DEL_IDLE);
00390     }
00391     if (prio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                               /* Task priority valid ?               */
00392         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {       
00393             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00394         }
00395     }
00396 #endif
00397     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00398     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                                 /* See if requesting to delete self    */
00399         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;                             /* Set priority to delete to current   */
00400     }
00401     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00402     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                                  /* Task to delete must exist           */
00403         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00404         return (OS_TASK_DEL_ERR);
00405     }
00406     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                                  /* Must not be assigned to Mutex       */
00407         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00408         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00409     }
00410         y            =  ptcb->OSTCBY;
00411         OSRdyTbl[y] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00412     if (OSRdyTbl[y] == 0x00) {                                  /* Make task not ready                 */
00413         OSRdyGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00414     }
00415 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00416     pevent = ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr;
00417     if (pevent != (OS_EVENT *)0) {                              /* If task is waiting on event         */
00418             pevent->OSEventTbl[y] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00419         if (pevent->OSEventTbl[y] == 0) {                       /* ... remove task from ...            */
00420             pevent->OSEventGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;             /* ... event ctrl block                */
00421         }
00422     }
00423 #endif
00424 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0)
00425     pnode = ptcb->OSTCBFlagNode;
00426     if (pnode != (OS_FLAG_NODE *)0) {                           /* If task is waiting on event flag    */
00427         OS_FlagUnlink(pnode);                                   /* Remove from wait list               */
00428     }
00429 #endif
00430     ptcb->OSTCBDly    = 0;                                      /* Prevent OSTimeTick() from updating  */
00431     ptcb->OSTCBStat   = OS_STAT_RDY;                            /* Prevent task from being resumed     */
00432     ptcb->OSTCBPendTO = FALSE;
00433         if (OSLockNesting < 255u) {                                 /* Make sure we don't context switch   */
00434         OSLockNesting++;
00435         }
00436     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                                         /* Enabling INT. ignores next instruc. */
00437     OS_Dummy();                                                 /* ... Dummy ensures that INTs will be */
00438     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();                                        /* ... disabled HERE!                  */
00439         if (OSLockNesting > 0) {                                    /* Remove context switch lock          */
00440         OSLockNesting--;
00441         }
00442     OSTaskDelHook(ptcb);                                        /* Call user defined hook              */
00443     OSTaskCtr--;                                                /* One less task being managed         */
00444     OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)0;                           /* Clear old priority entry            */
00445     if (ptcb->OSTCBPrev == (OS_TCB *)0) {                       /* Remove from TCB chain               */
00446         ptcb->OSTCBNext->OSTCBPrev = (OS_TCB *)0;
00447         OSTCBList                  = ptcb->OSTCBNext;
00448     } else {
00449         ptcb->OSTCBPrev->OSTCBNext = ptcb->OSTCBNext;
00450         ptcb->OSTCBNext->OSTCBPrev = ptcb->OSTCBPrev;
00451     }
00452     ptcb->OSTCBNext   = OSTCBFreeList;                          /* Return TCB to free TCB list         */
00453     OSTCBFreeList     = ptcb;
00454 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
00455     ptcb->OSTCBTaskName[0] = '?';                               /* Unknown name                        */
00456     ptcb->OSTCBTaskName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00457 #endif
00458     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00459     OS_Sched();                                                 /* Find new highest priority task      */
00460     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00461 }
00462 #endif
00463 /*$PAGE*/
00464 /*
00465 *********************************************************************************************************
00466 *                                    REQUEST THAT A TASK DELETE ITSELF
00467 *
00468 * Description: This function is used to:
00469 *                   a) notify a task to delete itself.
00470 *                   b) to see if a task requested that the current task delete itself.
00471 *              This function is a little tricky to understand.  Basically, you have a task that needs
00472 *              to be deleted however, this task has resources that it has allocated (memory buffers,
00473 *              semaphores, mailboxes, queues etc.).  The task cannot be deleted otherwise these
00474 *              resources would not be freed.  The requesting task calls OSTaskDelReq() to indicate that
00475 *              the task needs to be deleted.  Deleting of the task is however, deferred to the task to
00476 *              be deleted.  For example, suppose that task #10 needs to be deleted.  The requesting task
00477 *              example, task #5, would call OSTaskDelReq(10).  When task #10 gets to execute, it calls
00478 *              this function by specifying OS_PRIO_SELF and monitors the returned value.  If the return
00479 *              value is OS_TASK_DEL_REQ, another task requested a task delete.  Task #10 would look like
00480 *              this:
00481 *
00482 *                   void Task(void *p_arg)
00483 *                   {
00484 *                       .
00485 *                       .
00486 *                       while (1) {
00487 *                           OSTimeDly(1);
00488 *                           if (OSTaskDelReq(OS_PRIO_SELF) == OS_TASK_DEL_REQ) {
00489 *                               Release any owned resources;
00490 *                               De-allocate any dynamic memory;
00491 *                               OSTaskDel(OS_PRIO_SELF);
00492 *                           }
00493 *                       }
00494 *                   }
00495 *
00496 * Arguments  : prio    is the priority of the task to request the delete from
00497 *
00498 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR          if the task exist and the request has been registered
00499 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST  if the task has been deleted.  This allows the caller to know whether
00500 *                                 the request has been executed.
00501 *              OS_TASK_DEL_ERR    if the task is assigned to a Mutex.
00502 *              OS_TASK_DEL_IDLE   if you requested to delete uC/OS-II's idle task
00503 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID    if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00504 *                                 (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) or, you have not specified OS_PRIO_SELF.
00505 *              OS_TASK_DEL_REQ    if a task (possibly another task) requested that the running task be
00506 *                                 deleted.
00507 *********************************************************************************************************
00508 */
00509 /*$PAGE*/
00510 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
00511 INT8U  OSTaskDelReq (INT8U prio)
00512 {
00513     INT8U      stat;
00514     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00515 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00516     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00517 #endif    
00518 
00519 
00520 
00521 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00522     if (prio == OS_IDLE_PRIO) {                                 /* Not allowed to delete idle task     */
00523         return (OS_TASK_DEL_IDLE);
00524     }
00525     if (prio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                                                       /* Task priority valid ?               */
00526         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {                       
00527             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00528                 }
00529     }
00530 #endif
00531     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                                 /* See if a task is requesting to ...  */
00532         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();                                    /* ... this task to delete itself      */
00533         stat = OSTCBCur->OSTCBDelReq;                           /* Return request status to caller     */
00534         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00535         return (stat);
00536     }
00537     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00538     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00539     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                                  /* Task to delete must exist           */
00540         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00541         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);                             /* Task must already be deleted        */
00542     }
00543     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                                  /* Must NOT be assigned to a Mutex     */
00544         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00545         return (OS_TASK_DEL_ERR);
00546     }
00547     ptcb->OSTCBDelReq = OS_TASK_DEL_REQ;                        /* Set flag indicating task to be DEL. */
00548     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00549     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00550 }
00551 #endif
00552 /*$PAGE*/
00553 /*
00554 *********************************************************************************************************
00555 *                                        GET THE NAME OF A TASK
00556 *
00557 * Description: This function is called to obtain the name of a task.
00558 *
00559 * Arguments  : prio      is the priority of the task that you want to obtain the name from.
00560 *
00561 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that will receive the name of the task.  The 
00562 *                        string must be able to hold at least OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE characters.
00563 *
00564 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00565 *
00566 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the requested task is resumed
00567 *                        OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST          if the task has not been created or is assigned to a Mutex
00568 *                        OS_PRIO_INVALID            if you specified an invalid priority:
00569 *                                                   A higher value than the idle task or not OS_PRIO_SELF.
00570 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00571 *
00572 * Returns    : The length of the string or 0 if the task does not exist.
00573 *********************************************************************************************************
00574 */
00575 
00576 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
00577 INT8U  OSTaskNameGet (INT8U prio, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00578 {
00579     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00580     INT8U      len;
00581 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                              /* Allocate storage for CPU status register   */
00582     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00583 #endif    
00584 
00585 
00586 
00587 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00588     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                             /* Validate 'err'                             */
00589         return (0);
00590     }
00591     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                         /* Task priority valid ?                      */
00592         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) { 
00593             *err = OS_PRIO_INVALID;                      /* No                                         */
00594             return (0);
00595         }
00596     }
00597     if (pname == (char *)0) {                             /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                */
00598         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;                                                 /* Yes                                       */
00599         return (0);
00600     }
00601 #endif
00602     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00603     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                           /* See if caller desires it's own name       */
00604         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;
00605     }
00606     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00607     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                            /* Does task exist?                          */
00608         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                               /* No                                        */
00609         *err = OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST;
00610         return (0);
00611     }
00612     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                            /* Task assigned to a Mutex?                 */
00613         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                               /* Yes                                       */
00614         *err = OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST;
00615         return (0);
00616     }
00617     len  = OS_StrCopy(pname, ptcb->OSTCBTaskName);        /* Yes, copy name from TCB                   */
00618     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00619     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00620     return (len);
00621 }
00622 #endif
00623 
00624 /*$PAGE*/
00625 /*
00626 *********************************************************************************************************
00627 *                                        ASSIGN A NAME TO A TASK
00628 *
00629 * Description: This function is used to set the name of a task.
00630 *
00631 * Arguments  : prio      is the priority of the task that you want the assign a name to.
00632 *
00633 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that contains the name of the task.  The ASCII
00634 *                        string must be NUL terminated.
00635 *
00636 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00637 *
00638 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the requested task is resumed
00639 *                        OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST          if the task has not been created or is assigned to a Mutex
00640 *                        OS_ERR_TASK_NAME_TOO_LONG  if the name you are giving to the task exceeds the 
00641 *                                                   storage capacity of a task name as specified by 
00642 *                                                   OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE.
00643 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00644 *                        OS_PRIO_INVALID            if you specified an invalid priority:
00645 *                                                   A higher value than the idle task or not OS_PRIO_SELF.
00646 *
00647 * Returns    : None
00648 *********************************************************************************************************
00649 */
00650 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
00651 void  OSTaskNameSet (INT8U prio, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00652 {
00653     INT8U      len;
00654     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00655 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                          /* Allocate storage for CPU status register       */
00656     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00657 #endif    
00658 
00659 
00660 
00661 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00662     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                         /* Validate 'err'                                 */
00663         return;
00664     }
00665     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                     /* Task priority valid ?                          */
00666         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {              
00667             *err = OS_PRIO_INVALID;                  /* No                                             */
00668             return;
00669         }
00670     }
00671     if (pname == (char *)0) {                        /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                     */
00672         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;                                        /* Yes                                            */
00673         return;
00674     }
00675 #endif
00676     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00677     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                      /* See if caller desires to set it's own name     */
00678         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;
00679     }
00680     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00681     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                       /* Does task exist?                               */
00682         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                          /* No                                             */
00683         *err = OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST;
00684         return;
00685     }
00686     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                       /* Task assigned to a Mutex?                      */
00687         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                          /* Yes                                            */
00688         *err = OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST;
00689         return;
00690     }
00691     len = OS_StrLen(pname);                          /* Yes, Can we fit the string in the TCB?         */
00692     if (len > (OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE - 1)) {             /*      No                                        */
00693         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00694         *err = OS_ERR_TASK_NAME_TOO_LONG;
00695         return;
00696     } 
00697     (void)OS_StrCopy(ptcb->OSTCBTaskName, pname);    /*      Yes, copy to TCB                          */
00698     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00699     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00700 }
00701 #endif
00702 
00703 /*$PAGE*/
00704 /*
00705 *********************************************************************************************************
00706 *                                        RESUME A SUSPENDED TASK
00707 *
00708 * Description: This function is called to resume a previously suspended task.  This is the only call that
00709 *              will remove an explicit task suspension.
00710 *
00711 * Arguments  : prio     is the priority of the task to resume.
00712 *
00713 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR                if the requested task is resumed
00714 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID          if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00715 *                                       (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO)
00716 *              OS_TASK_RESUME_PRIO      if the task to resume does not exist
00717 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST        if the task is assigned to a Mutex PIP
00718 *              OS_TASK_NOT_SUSPENDED    if the task to resume has not been suspended
00719 *********************************************************************************************************
00720 */
00721 
00722 #if OS_TASK_SUSPEND_EN > 0
00723 INT8U  OSTaskResume (INT8U prio)
00724 {
00725     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00726 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                   /* Storage for CPU status register       */
00727     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00728 #endif    
00729 
00730 
00731 
00732 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00733     if (prio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                             /* Make sure task priority is valid      */
00734         return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00735     }
00736 #endif
00737     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00738     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00739     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                                /* Task to suspend must exist            */
00740         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00741         return (OS_TASK_RESUME_PRIO);
00742     }
00743     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                                /* See if assigned to Mutex              */
00744         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00745         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00746     }
00747     if ((ptcb->OSTCBStat & OS_STAT_SUSPEND) != OS_STAT_RDY) { /* Task must be suspended                */
00748         ptcb->OSTCBStat &= ~OS_STAT_SUSPEND;                              /* Remove suspension                     */
00749         if (ptcb->OSTCBStat == OS_STAT_RDY) {                 /* See if task is now ready              */
00750             if (ptcb->OSTCBDly == 0) {
00751                 OSRdyGrp               |= ptcb->OSTCBBitY;    /* Yes, Make task ready to run           */
00752                 OSRdyTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] |= ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00753                 OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00754                 OS_Sched();
00755             } else {
00756                 OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00757             }
00758         } else {                                              /* Must be pending on event              */
00759                     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00760         }
00761         return (OS_NO_ERR);
00762     }
00763     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00764     return (OS_TASK_NOT_SUSPENDED);
00765 }
00766 #endif
00767 /*$PAGE*/
00768 /*
00769 *********************************************************************************************************
00770 *                                             STACK CHECKING
00771 *
00772 * Description: This function is called to check the amount of free memory left on the specified task's
00773 *              stack.
00774 *
00775 * Arguments  : prio          is the task priority
00776 *
00777 *              p_stk_data    is a pointer to a data structure of type OS_STK_DATA.
00778 *
00779 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR           upon success
00780 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID     if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00781 *                                  (i.e. > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) or, you have not specified OS_PRIO_SELF.
00782 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST   if the desired task has not been created or is assigned to a Mutex PIP
00783 *              OS_TASK_OPT_ERR     if you did NOT specified OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK when the task was created
00784 *              OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL   if 'p_stk_data' is a NULL pointer
00785 *********************************************************************************************************
00786 */
00787 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
00788 INT8U  OSTaskStkChk (INT8U prio, OS_STK_DATA *p_stk_data)
00789 {
00790     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00791     OS_STK    *pchk;
00792     INT32U     free;
00793     INT32U     size;
00794 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                            /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
00795     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00796 #endif    
00797 
00798 
00799 
00800 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00801     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                       /* Make sure task priority is valid             */
00802         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {        
00803             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00804         }
00805     }
00806     if (p_stk_data == (OS_STK_DATA *)0) {              /* Validate 'p_stk_data'                        */
00807         return (OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL);
00808     }
00809 #endif
00810     p_stk_data->OSFree = 0;                            /* Assume failure, set to 0 size                */
00811     p_stk_data->OSUsed = 0;
00812     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00813     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                        /* See if check for SELF                        */
00814         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;
00815     }
00816     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00817     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                         /* Make sure task exist                         */
00818         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00819         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00820     }
00821     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {
00822         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00823         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00824     }  
00825     if ((ptcb->OSTCBOpt & OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK) == 0) { /* Make sure stack checking option is set       */
00826         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00827         return (OS_TASK_OPT_ERR);
00828     }
00829     free = 0;
00830     size = ptcb->OSTCBStkSize;
00831     pchk = ptcb->OSTCBStkBottom;
00832     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00833 #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1
00834     while (*pchk++ == (OS_STK)0) {                    /* Compute the number of zero entries on the stk */
00835         free++;
00836     }
00837 #else
00838     while (*pchk-- == (OS_STK)0) {
00839         free++;
00840     }
00841 #endif
00842     p_stk_data->OSFree = free * sizeof(OS_STK);           /* Compute number of free bytes on the stack */
00843     p_stk_data->OSUsed = (size - free) * sizeof(OS_STK);  /* Compute number of bytes used on the stack */
00844     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00845 }
00846 #endif
00847 /*$PAGE*/
00848 /*
00849 *********************************************************************************************************
00850 *                                            SUSPEND A TASK
00851 *
00852 * Description: This function is called to suspend a task.  The task can be the calling task if the
00853 *              priority passed to OSTaskSuspend() is the priority of the calling task or OS_PRIO_SELF.
00854 *
00855 * Arguments  : prio     is the priority of the task to suspend.  If you specify OS_PRIO_SELF, the
00856 *                       calling task will suspend itself and rescheduling will occur.
00857 *
00858 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR                if the requested task is suspended
00859 *              OS_TASK_SUSPEND_IDLE     if you attempted to suspend the idle task which is not allowed.
00860 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID          if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00861 *                                       (i.e. >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) or, you have not specified OS_PRIO_SELF.
00862 *              OS_TASK_SUSPEND_PRIO     if the task to suspend does not exist
00863 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXITS        if the task is assigned to a Mutex PIP
00864 *
00865 * Note       : You should use this function with great care.  If you suspend a task that is waiting for
00866 *              an event (i.e. a message, a semaphore, a queue ...) you will prevent this task from
00867 *              running when the event arrives.
00868 *********************************************************************************************************
00869 */
00870 
00871 #if OS_TASK_SUSPEND_EN > 0
00872 INT8U  OSTaskSuspend (INT8U prio)
00873 {
00874     BOOLEAN    self;
00875     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00876         INT8U      y;
00877 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00878     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00879 #endif    
00880 
00881 
00882 
00883 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00884     if (prio == OS_IDLE_PRIO) {                                 /* Not allowed to suspend idle task    */
00885         return (OS_TASK_SUSPEND_IDLE);
00886     }
00887     if (prio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                                                               /* Task priority valid ?               */
00888         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {
00889             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00890         }
00891     }
00892 #endif
00893     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00894     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                                 /* See if suspend SELF                 */
00895         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;
00896         self = TRUE;
00897     } else if (prio == OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio) {                   /* See if suspending self              */
00898         self = TRUE;
00899     } else {
00900         self = FALSE;                                           /* No suspending another task          */
00901     }
00902     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00903     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                                  /* Task to suspend must exist          */
00904         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00905         return (OS_TASK_SUSPEND_PRIO);
00906     }
00907     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                                  /* See if assigned to Mutex            */
00908         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00909         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00910     }
00911         y            = ptcb->OSTCBY;
00912         OSRdyTbl[y] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;                                                        /* Make task not ready                 */
00913     if (OSRdyTbl[y] == 0x00) { 
00914         OSRdyGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00915     }
00916     ptcb->OSTCBStat |= OS_STAT_SUSPEND;                         /* Status of task is 'SUSPENDED'       */
00917     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00918     if (self == TRUE) {                                         /* Context switch only if SELF         */
00919         OS_Sched();
00920     }
00921     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00922 }
00923 #endif
00924 /*$PAGE*/
00925 /*
00926 *********************************************************************************************************
00927 *                                            QUERY A TASK
00928 *
00929 * Description: This function is called to obtain a copy of the desired task's TCB.
00930 *
00931 * Arguments  : prio         is the priority of the task to obtain information from.
00932 *
00933 *              p_task_data  is a pointer to where the desired task's OS_TCB will be stored.
00934 *
00935 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR          if the requested task is suspended
00936 *              OS_PRIO_INVALID    if the priority you specify is higher that the maximum allowed
00937 *                                 (i.e. > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) or, you have not specified OS_PRIO_SELF.
00938 *              OS_PRIO_ERR        if the desired task has not been created
00939 *              OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST  if the task is assigned to a Mutex PIP
00940 *              OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL  if 'p_task_data' is a NULL pointer
00941 *********************************************************************************************************
00942 */
00943 
00944 #if OS_TASK_QUERY_EN > 0
00945 INT8U  OSTaskQuery (INT8U prio, OS_TCB *p_task_data)
00946 {
00947     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00948 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00949     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00950 #endif    
00951 
00952 
00953 
00954 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00955     if (prio > OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                                 /* Task priority valid ?                              */
00956         if (prio != OS_PRIO_SELF) {   
00957             return (OS_PRIO_INVALID);
00958         }
00959     }
00960     if (p_task_data == (OS_TCB *)0) {            /* Validate 'p_task_data'                             */
00961         return (OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL);
00962     }
00963 #endif
00964     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00965     if (prio == OS_PRIO_SELF) {                  /* See if suspend SELF                                */
00966         prio = OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;
00967     }
00968     ptcb = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];
00969     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)0) {                   /* Task to query must exist                           */
00970         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00971         return (OS_PRIO_ERR);
00972     }
00973     if (ptcb == (OS_TCB *)1) {                   /* Task to query must not be assigned to a Mutex      */
00974         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00975         return (OS_TASK_NOT_EXIST);
00976     }
00977                                                  /* Copy TCB into user storage area                    */
00978     OS_MemCopy((INT8U *)p_task_data, (INT8U *)ptcb, sizeof(OS_TCB));  
00979     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00980     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00981 }
00982 #endif
00983 /*$PAGE*/
00984 /*
00985 *********************************************************************************************************
00986 *                                        CLEAR TASK STACK
00987 *
00988 * Description: This function is used to clear the stack of a task (i.e. write all zeros)
00989 *
00990 * Arguments  : pbos     is a pointer to the task's bottom of stack.  If the configuration constant
00991 *                       OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1, the stack is assumed to grow downward (i.e. from high
00992 *                       memory to low memory).  'pbos' will thus point to the lowest (valid) memory
00993 *                       location of the stack.  If OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0, 'pbos' will point to the
00994 *                       highest memory location of the stack and the stack will grow with increasing
00995 *                       memory locations.  'pbos' MUST point to a valid 'free' data item.
00996 *
00997 *              size     is the number of 'stack elements' to clear.
00998 *
00999 *              opt      contains additional information (or options) about the behavior of the task.  The
01000 *                       LOWER 8-bits are reserved by uC/OS-II while the upper 8 bits can be application
01001 *                       specific.  See OS_TASK_OPT_??? in uCOS-II.H.
01002 *
01003 * Returns    : none
01004 *********************************************************************************************************
01005 */
01006 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
01007 void  OS_TaskStkClr (OS_STK *pbos, INT32U size, INT16U opt)
01008 {
01009     if ((opt & OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK) != 0x0000) {       /* See if stack checking has been enabled       */
01010         if ((opt & OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR) != 0x0000) {   /* See if stack needs to be cleared             */
01011 #if OS_STK_GROWTH == 1                     
01012             while (size > 0) {                         /* Stack grows from HIGH to LOW memory          */
01013                 size--;
01014                 *pbos++ = (OS_STK)0;                   /* Clear from bottom of stack and up!           */
01015             }
01016 #else
01017             while (size > 0) {                         /* Stack grows from LOW to HIGH memory          */
01018                 size--;
01019                 *pbos-- = (OS_STK)0;                   /* Clear from bottom of stack and down          */
01020             }
01021 #endif
01022         }
01023     }
01024 }
01025 
01026 #endif
Generated on Sun Feb 26 21:45:24 2006 for oxf8548_fnlprj by  1.4.6-NO
